sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Sir Arthur Hesilrige's letter to the honorable committee of Lords & Commons at Derby-House, concerning the revolt and recovery of Tinmouth-castle. In which action, Lieutenant Col: Lilburn (Governor of the castle) was slain, with divers seamen and others. Hesilrige, Arthur, Sir, d. 1661.
7, [1] p.
Printed for Edward Husband, printer to the Honorable House of Commons, London : August 15. 1648.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Sir Arthur Hesilrige's letter to the honorable committee of Lords & Commons at Derby-House, concerning the revolt and recovery of Tinmouth-castle. In which action, Lieutenant Col: Lilburn (Governor of the castle) was slain, with divers seamen and others. Hesilrige, Arthur, Sir, d. 1661.
7, [1] p.
Printed for Edward Husband, printer to the Honorable House of Commons, London : August 15. 1648.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
the Honorable House of Commons
Edward Husband
